long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20071023-1652
Steps To Reproduce: 1.Update eclise 3.3.1.1 from the help menu 2.Mark with V Eclipse RCP Patch 1 for 3.3.1.1 3.3.1.1_v20071204_3311, as found on http://ftp.osuosl.org/pub/eclipse/eclipse/updates/3.3/site.xml 3.Next until error
More information: Update operation has failed Error retrieving "plugins/com.ibm.icu36.data.update_3.6.1.v20071204_2007j.jar". [Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://ftp.osuosl.org/pub/eclipse/eclipse/updates/3.3/plugins/com.ibm.icu36.data.update_3.6.1.v20071204_2007j.jar.] Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://ftp.osuosl.org/pub/eclipse/eclipse/updates/3.3/plugins/com.ibm.icu36.data.update_3.6.1.v20071204_2007j.jar.
Running on winxp
Did you try using a different mirror?

In my case, I do not get the notification of the availability of RCP Patch 1 for Eclipse 3.3.1.1 when doing a "search for updates of currently installed features". I must do a "search for new features to install", check Eclipse Project Update Site AND *UNCHECK* "Show the latest version of a feature only" in order to get the folder "Eclipse 3.3.1.1 patches" with "Eclipse RCP Patch 1 for 3.3.1.1"...
I didn't try to install it, because: 1) I don't know what it is for... 2) I struggled for some hours with update manager and eventually deleted "Eclipse RCP Patch 1 for 3.3" because it prevented me from updating other features I actually needed (i.e. Mylyn 2.2)... so I didn't dare to try another patch like that...
Moreover: having Eclipse 3.3.1.1: 1) do I need Patch 1 for 3.3? 2) do I need Patch 2 for 3.3? 3) do I need Patch 1 for 3.3.1.1? What are they for? Is there any link between them? I couldn't find any source describing their functionality...
Mauro.

Sorry, by "Patch 1 for 3.3" and "Patch 2 for 3.3" I actually meant "Patch 1 for 3.3.1" and "Patch 2 for 3.3.1".
Mauro.

The Eclipse Update component is no longer under development, and no longer exists in the Eclipse Platform 4.x stream. If this problem still occurs in Eclipse Platform 4.2 or later, please enter a new bug report against Equinox p2.
